perturbation.original_text:
8.  8 This Agreement will be governed by, construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Texas. Any dispute between
the Parties regarding or related to this Agreement shall be litigated in the courts located in Houston, Texas, and WPD agrees not to challenge
personal jurisdiction in that forum.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.  8 This Agreement will be governed by, construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Texas. Any dispute between
the Parties regarding or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through friendly negotiation. If such negotiation fails, the parties may consider litigation in the courts located in Houston, Texas, and WPD agrees not to challenge
personal jurisdiction in that forum.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates litigation in Houston, Texas. The modified clause introduces a contradiction by stating that disputes should first be resolved through friendly negotiation, potentially negating or delaying the original agreement for litigation in the specified forum, therefore impacting enforceability of the original dispute resolution agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
5.4 Data Privacy and Security Laws. WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) will at all times during the Term be in material compliance with all
applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations, and WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) have taken or will take commercially reasonable
actions to comply with the European Union General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”) (EU 2016/679) and all other applicable laws and
regulations with respect to Personal Data (defined below) that have been announced as of the date hereof as becoming effective within 12 months
after the date hereof, and for which any non-compliance with same would be reasonably likely to create a material liability (collectively, the “Privacy
Laws”). To WPD’s knowledge, WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) have been and currently are in material compliance with the GDPR. To ensure
material compliance with the Privacy Laws, WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) have taken, and currently take, commercially reasonable steps
reasonably designed to ensure compliance in all material respects with Privacy Laws relating to data privacy and security and the collection,
storage, use, disclosure, handling, and analysis of Personal Data that WPD has collected, and collects, or is in WPD’s possession or will be in
WPD’s possession during the Term. “Personal Data” means "personal data" as defined by GDPR.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4 Data Privacy and Security Laws. WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) will at all times during the Term use commercially reasonable effort to comply with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations, and WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) have taken or will take best effort actions to comply with the European Union General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”) (EU 2016/679) and all other applicable laws and
regulations with respect to Personal Data (defined below) that have been announced as of the date hereof as becoming effective within 12 months
after the date hereof, and for which any non-compliance with same would be reasonably likely to create a material liability (collectively, the “Privacy
Laws”). To WPD’s knowledge, WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) may or may not have been and currently are in material compliance with the GDPR. To ensure
material compliance with the Privacy Laws, WPD and its subsidiaries (if any) may or may not have taken, and currently take, commercially reasonable steps
reasonably designed to ensure compliance in all material respects with Privacy Laws relating to data privacy and security and the collection,
storage, use, disclosure, handling, and analysis of Personal Data that WPD has collected, and collects, or is in WPD’s possession or will be in
WPD’s possession during the Term. “Personal Data” means "personal data" as defined by GDPR.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause guarantees material compliance with privacy laws, notably GDPR. The modified version waters down this guarantee by introducing uncertainty ('may or may not have been', 'use commercially reasonable effort to comply with') about WPD's commitment and historical compliance. This contradiction undermines the initial strong statement, creating ambiguity regarding data privacy obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
7.2.4 WPD understands and agrees that CNS may terminate this Agreement immediately and without any early termination
penalty in the event that WPD, or any of its affiliates, materially violates the FCPA or any other anti-bribery or anti-corruption law. WPD
understands and agrees that, if WPD, or any of its affiliates, intends to use foreign subcontractors to provide any services pursuant to this
Agreement, such party and each of its affiliates is prohibited from engaging or using subcontractors for performance of services under this
Agreement without prior and express authorization, in writing, by CNS. If WPD, or any of its affiliates, is authorized to engage or use
subcontractors for such work, such party and each of its affiliates so involved agrees to obtain a commitment from the subcontractor to comply
with the FCPA and any other anti-bribery or anti-corruption law.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.2.4 WPD understands and agrees that CNS may consider terminating this Agreement with early termination
penalty in the event that WPD, or any of its affiliates, violates the FCPA or any other anti-bribery or anti-corruption law. WPD
understands and agrees that, if WPD, or any of its affiliates, intends to use foreign subcontractors to provide any services pursuant to this
Agreement, such party and each of its affiliates is encouraged from engaging or using subcontractors for performance of services under this
Agreement without prior and express authorization, in writing, by CNS. If WPD, or any of its affiliates, is authorized to engage or use
subcontractors for such work, such party and each of its affiliates so involved agrees to obtain a commitment from the subcontractor to use best efforts to comply
with the FCPA and any other anti-bribery or anti-corruption law.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows for immediate termination without penalty if WPD violates FCPA. The modification introduces ambiguity by stating CNS may *consider* terminating the agreement *with* an early termination penalty, contradicting the original immediate and penalty-free termination. Furthermore, the switch from 'is prohibited' to 'is encouraged from' regarding subcontractor usage without authorization weakens the control CNS has. Finally, the transition of using 'best efforts' to comply instead of full compliance, allows some leeway.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 (FCPA)
